summary.span: 提供用于创建、复制、删除、移动和打开单一文件的静态方法，并协助创建 对象。

span.span: Provides static methods for the creation, copying, deletion, moving, and opening of a single file, and aids in the creation of objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用类用于典型操作，如复制、 移动、 重命名、 创建、 打开、 删除，并将追加到单个文件一次。Use the class for typical operations such as copying, moving, renaming, creating, opening, deleting, and appending to a single file at a time. 你还可以使用类获取和设置文件属性或与创建、 相关的信息访问和写入的文件。You can also use the class to get and set file attributes or information related to the creation, access, and writing of a file. 如果你想要对多个文件执行操作，请参阅或。If you want to perform operations on multiple files, see or . 许多方法返回其他 I/O 类型，创建或打开文件时。Many of the methods return other I/O types when you create or open files. 你可以使用这些其他类型来进一步处理文件。You can use these other types to further manipulate a file. 有关详细信息，请参阅特定成员，如， ，或。For more information, see specific members such as , , or . 因为所有方法是静态的它可能会更加高效，若要使用方法，而不是相应实例方法，如果你想要执行一个操作。Because all methods are static, it might be more efficient to use a method rather than a corresponding instance method if you want to perform only one action. 所有方法要求您操作的文件的路径。All methods require the path to the file that you are manipulating. 静态方法类执行的所有方法的安全检查。The static methods of the class perform security checks on all methods. 如果想要重用多次的某个对象，请考虑使用相应的实例方法的相反，因为安全检查将不总是有必要。If you are going to reuse an object several times, consider using the corresponding instance method of instead, because the security check will not always be necessary. 默认情况下，对新文件的完全读/写访问权限授予所有用户。By default, full read/write access to new files is granted to all users. 下表描述了用于自定义的各种行为的枚举方法。The following table describes the enumerations that are used to customize the behavior of various methods. |枚举Enumeration|描述Description| |-----------------|-----------------| ||指定读取和写入到文件的访问。Specifies read and write access to a file.| ||指定允许已在使用的文件的访问级别。Specifies the level of access permitted for a file that is already in use.| ||指定现有文件的内容是保留还是覆盖，以及请求创建现有文件是否会导致异常。Specifies whether the contents of an existing file are preserved or overwritten, and whether requests to create an existing file cause an exception.| > [!NOTE] > 在接受将路径作为输入字符串的成员，该路径必须是格式正确，或引发异常。In members that accept a path as an input string, that path must be well-formed or an exception is raised. 例如，如果路径是完全限定的但以空格开始，在类的方法不修整路径。For example, if a path is fully qualified but begins with a space, the path is not trimmed in methods of the class. 因此，该路径格式不正确并且引发异常。Therefore, the path is malformed and an exception is raised. 同样，路径或组合的路径不能完全限定两次。Similarly, a path or a combination of paths cannot be fully qualified twice. 例如，"c:\temp c:\windows"也会引发异常在大多数情况下。For example, "c:\temp c:\windows" also raises an exception in most cases. 确保使用接受将路径字符串的方法时，你的路径格式正确。Ensure that your paths are well-formed when using methods that accept a path string. 在接受路径的成员，路径可以引用一个文件或仅是目录。In members that accept a path, the path can refer to a file or just a directory. 指定的路径也可以指相对路径或服务器和共享名称的通用命名约定 (UNC) 路径。The specified path can also refer to a relative path or a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path for a server and share name. 例如，以下所有条件都可接受的路径：For example, all the following are acceptable paths: - "c:\\\MyDir\\\MyFile.txt"在 C# 或 Visual Basic 中的"c:\MyDir\MyFile.txt"。"c:\\\MyDir\\\MyFile.txt" in C#, or "c:\MyDir\MyFile.txt" in Visual Basic. - "c:\\\MyDir"在 C# 或 Visual Basic 中的"c:\MyDir"。"c:\\\MyDir" in C#, or "c:\MyDir" in Visual Basic. - "MyDir\\\MySubdir"在 C# 或 Visual Basic 中的"MyDir\MySubDir"。"MyDir\\\MySubdir" in C#, or "MyDir\MySubDir" in Visual Basic. - "\\\\\\\MyServer\\\MyShare"在 C# 中，或"\\\MyServer\MyShare"在 Visual Basic 中。"\\\\\\\MyServer\\\MyShare" in C#, or "\\\MyServer\MyShare" in Visual Basic. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用类，以检查是否存在文件，并根据结果，可以创建一个新文件并向其中写入，或打开现有文件，从其中进行读取。The following example demonstrates how to use the class to check whether a file exists, and depending on the result, either create a new file and write to it, or open the existing file and read from it. 运行代码之前，创建`c:\temp`文件夹。Before running the code, create a `c:\temp` folder. [!code-cpp[File Class Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/File Class Example/CPP/file class example.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[File Class Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/File Class Example/CS/file class example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[File Class Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/File Class Example/VB/file class example.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果不存在，但它不会创建新目录，该方法将创建该文件。The method creates the file if it doesn’t exist, but it doesn't create new directories. 因此，值`path`参数必须包含现有目录。Therefore, the value of the `path` parameter must contain existing directories. ## Examples 下面的示例从示例数据文件的选定的行写入到文件，并则后面添加更多的行。The following example writes selected lines from a sample data file to a file, and then appends more lines. 名为的目录`temp`C 必须存在成功完成该示例的驱动器上。The directory named `temp` on drive C must exist for the example to complete successfully. span.span: If the file does not exist, this method creates a file, writes the specified string to the file, then closes the file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法给定字符串和文件路径，在打开指定的文件，将字符串追加到文件的末尾，然后关闭该文件。Given a string and a file path, this method opens the specified file, appends the string to the end of the file, and then closes the file. 文件句柄保证即将关闭此方法，即使引发异常。The file handle is guaranteed to be closed by this method, even if exceptions are raised. 如果不存在，但它不会创建新目录，该方法将创建该文件。The method creates the file if it doesn’t exist, but it doesn't create new directories. 因此，值`path`参数必须包含现有目录。Therefore, the value of the `path` parameter must contain existing directories. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将方法将额外的文本添加到文件末尾。The following code example demonstrates the use of the method to add extra text to the end of a file. 在此示例中，如果它尚不存在，并且文本已添加到它创建一个文件。In this example, a file is created if it doesn't already exist, and text is added to it. 但是，目录名`temp`C 必须存在成功完成该示例的驱动器上。However, the directory named `temp` on drive C must exist for the example to complete successfully. span.span: Creates a that appends UTF-8 encoded text to an existing file, or to a new file if the specified file does not exist.

returns.span: 一个流写入器，它将 UTF-8 编码文本追加到指定文件或新文件。

span.span: A stream writer that appends UTF-8 encoded text to the specified file or to a new file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法相当于构造函数重载。This method is equivalent to the constructor overload. 如果指定的文件`path`不存在，则创建它。If the file specified by `path` does not exist, it is created. 如果存在该文件，写入到操作将文本追加到文件。If the file does exist, write operations to the append text to the file. 允许其他线程处于打开状态时读取文件。Additional threads are permitted to read the file while it is open. `path`参数允许指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `path` parameter is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请参阅。To obtain the current working directory, see . `path`参数不区分大小写。The `path` parameter is not case-sensitive. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例将文本追加到文件。The following example appends text to a file. 如果文件不存在，该方法将创建一个新文件。The method creates a new file if the file doesn’t exist. 但是，目录名`temp`C 必须存在成功完成该示例的驱动器上。However, the directory named `temp` on drive C must exist for the example to complete successfully. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法相当于方法重载`overwrite`参数设置为`false`。This method is equivalent to the method overload with the `overwrite` parameter set to `false`. `sourceFileName`和`destFileName`参数可指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `sourceFileName` and `destFileName` parameters can specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请参阅方法。To obtain the current working directory, see the method. 此方法不支持的参数中的通配符。This method does not support wildcard characters in the parameters. 在复制的文件中保留的原始文件的属性。The attributes of the original file are retained in the copied file. ## Examples 下面的示例将文件复制到 C:\archives\2008 备份文件夹。The following example copies files to the C:\archives\2008 backup folder. 它使用的两个重载方法，如下所示：It uses the two overloads of the method as follows: - 首先使用方法重载来复制文本 (.txt) 文件。It first uses the method overload to copy text (.txt) files. 代码演示此重载不允许覆盖已复制的文件。The code demonstrates that this overload does not allow overwriting files that were already copied. - 然后，它使用方法重载来复制图片 （.jpg 文件）。It then uses the method overload to copy pictures (.jpg files). 代码演示此重载确实允许覆盖已复制的文件。The code demonstrates that this overload does allow overwriting files that were already copied. param.name: path
param.span: 要创建的文件的路径及名称。

summary.span: 在指定路径中创建或覆盖文件。

returns.span: 一个 ，它提供对 中指定的文件的读/写访问。

span.span: A that provides read/write access to the file specified in .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 由该方法创建的对象具有一个默认值; 没有其他进程或代码在关闭原始文件句柄之前，可以访问创建的文件。The object created by this method has a default value of ; no other process or code can access the created file until the original file handle is closed. 此方法相当于方法重载使用默认的缓冲区大小。This method is equivalent to the method overload using the default buffer size. `path`参数允许指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `path` parameter is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请参阅。To obtain the current working directory, see . 如果指定的文件不存在，则创建它;如果它存在，并且不是只读的将覆盖的内容。If the specified file does not exist, it is created; if it does exist and it is not read-only, the contents are overwritten. 默认情况下，对新文件的完全读/写访问权限授予所有用户。By default, full read/write access to new files is granted to all users. 该文件以读/写访问权限打开，并且必须先关闭然后它可由其他应用程序中打开。The file is opened with read/write access and must be closed before it can be opened by another application. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个文件中指定的路径、 将某些信息写入文件，和从文件中读取。The following example creates a file in the specified path, writes some information to the file, and reads from the file. remarks.format: ## Remarks 由该方法创建的对象具有一个默认值; 没有其他进程或代码在关闭原始文件句柄之前，可以访问创建的文件。The object created by this method has a default value of ; no other process or code can access the created file until the original file handle is closed. `path`参数允许指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `path` parameter is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请参阅。To obtain the current working directory, see . 此方法相当于构造函数重载。This method is equivalent to the constructor overload. 如果指定的文件不存在，则创建它;如果它存在，并且不是只读的将覆盖的内容。If the specified file does not exist, it is created; if it does exist and it is not read-only, the contents are overwritten. 默认情况下，对新文件的完全读/写访问权限授予所有用户。By default, full read/write access to new files is granted to all users. 该文件以读/写访问权限打开，并且必须先关闭然后它可由其他应用程序中打开。The file is opened with read/write access and must be closed before it can be opened by another application. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例创建具有指定的缓冲区大小的文件。The following example creates a file with the specified buffer size. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法允许你使用加密文件进行解密方法。The method allows you to decrypt a file that was encrypted using the method. 方法可以解密使用当前用户帐户加密的文件。The method can decrypt only files that were encrypted using the current user account. 方法需要独占访问正在解密的文件，并将另一个进程正在使用该文件的情况下引发的异常。The method requires exclusive access to the file being decrypted, and will raise an exception if another process is using the file. 如果未加密文件，将返回非零值，该值指示成功。If the file is not encrypted, will return a nonzero value, which indicates success. 这两个方法和方法使用安装在计算机和调用方法的过程的文件加密密钥的加密服务提供程序 (CSP)。Both the method and the method use the cryptographic service provider (CSP) installed on the computer and the file encryption keys of the process calling the method. 当前的文件系统必须格式化为 NTFS 和当前的操作系统必须是 Windows NT 或更高版本。The current file system must be formatted as NTFS and the current operating system must be Windows NT or later. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用方法和方法加密，然后将解密文件。The following code example uses the method and the method to encrypt and then decrypt a file. 文件必须存在该示例能工作。The file must exist for the example to work. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法不应该用于路径验证，此方法只检查中指定的文件是否`path`存在。The method should not be used for path validation, this method merely checks if the file specified in `path` exists. 传递到无效的路径返回`false`。Passing an invalid path to returns `false`. 若要检查的路径是否包含任何无效字符，可以调用方法来检索文件系统对于无效的字符。To check whether the path contains any invalid characters, you can call the method to retrieve the characters that are invalid for the file system. 你还可以创建要测试是否正则表达式的路径对于你的环境是否有效。You can also create a regular expression to test the whether the path is valid for your environment. 有关可接受的路径的示例，请参阅。For examples of acceptable paths, see . 若要检查目录是否存在，请参阅。To check if a directory exists, see . 请注意，另一个进程可以可能进行一些处理在调用的时之间的文件方法并执行其他操作，该文件，如。Be aware that another process can potentially do something with the file in between the time you call the method and perform another operation on the file, such as . `path`参数允许指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `path` parameter is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请参阅。To obtain the current working directory, see . 如果`path`描述一个目录，此方法返回`false`。If `path` describes a directory, this method returns `false`. 从删除尾随空格`path`之前确定文件是否存在的参数。Trailing spaces are removed from the `path` parameter before determining if the file exists. 方法返回`false`如果在尝试确定指定的文件是否存在任何错误时发生。The method returns `false` if any error occurs while trying to determine if the specified file exists. 在引发异常，例如传递具有无效的字符或太多字符，磁盘失效或缺失的文件名的情况下可能发生这或如果调用方没有权限读取此文件。This can occur in situations that raise exceptions such as passing a file name with invalid characters or too many characters, a failing or missing disk, or if the caller does not have permission to read the file. ## Examples 下面的示例确定文件是否存在。The following example determines if a file exists. ACL 描述个人和/或组具有或没有执行到给定的文件上的特定操作的权限。An ACL describes individuals and/or groups who have, or do not have, rights to specific actions on the given file. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：添加或移除访问控制列表项](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md)。For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md). 在 NTFS 环境中，和如果用户具有向用户授予上的父文件夹的权限。In NTFS environments, and are granted to the user if the user has rights on the parent folder. 若要拒绝和，拒绝上的父目录。To deny and , deny on the parent directory. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用和方法添加，然后删除访问控制列表 (ACL) 项从一个文件。The following code example uses the and the methods to add and then remove an access control list (ACL) entry from a file. 你必须提供有效的用户或组帐户以运行此示例。You must supply a valid user or group account to run this example. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 此方法可能返回不准确的值，因为它使用其值可能不会持续更新由操作系统的本机函数。This method may return an inaccurate value, because it uses native functions whose values may not be continuously updated by the operating system. `path`参数允许指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `path` parameter is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请参阅。To obtain the current working directory, see . 如果该文件中所述`path`参数不存在，此方法将返回第午夜 12:00 到公元 1601 年 1 月 1 日If the file described in the `path` parameter does not exist, this method returns 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.)为本地时间调整协调世界时 (UTC)。(C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), adjusted to local time. NTFS 格式化的驱动器可能缓存文件，如短时间内的文件创建时间的信息。NTFS-formatted drives may cache information about a file, such as file creation time, for a short period of time. 因此，可能有必要显式设置文件的创建时间，如果要覆盖或替换现有文件。As a result, it may be necessary to explicitly set the creation time of a file if you are overwriting or replacing an existing file. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示`GetCreationTime`。The following example demonstrates `GetCreationTime`. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法相当于与文件模式设置的构造函数重载，访问权限设为，和共享模式设置为。This method is equivalent to the constructor overload with file mode set to , the access set to , and the share mode set to . 方法打开一个文件，如果一个已存在的文件路径，或创建一个新文件，如果不存在。The method opens a file if one already exists for the file path, or creates a new file if one does not exist. 对于现有的文件，它不会不新将文本追加到现有的文本。For an existing file, it does not append the new text to the existing text. 相反，它将用新的字符覆盖现有的字符。Instead, it overwrites the existing characters with the new characters. 如果使用较短字符串 （如"第二次运行"） （例如"This is OpenWrite 方法的测试)"覆盖较长的字符串，则文件将包含多种字符串 ("第二个 runtest OpenWrite 方法的")。If you overwrite a longer string (such as "This is a test of the OpenWrite method") with a shorter string (such as "Second run"), the file will contain a mix of the strings ("Second runtest of the OpenWrite method"). `path`参数可以指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `path` parameter may specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请使用方法。To obtain the current working directory, use the method. 返回不支持读取。The returned does not support reading. 若要打开文件进行读取和写入，请使用。To open a file for both reading and writing, use . 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例打开用于读取和写入文件。The following example opens a file for reading and writing. [!code-cpp[file openwrite#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/File OpenWrite/CPP/file openwrite.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[file openwrite#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/File OpenWrite/CS/file openwrite.cs#1)] [!code-vb[file openwrite#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/File OpenWrite/VB/file openwrite.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法打开一个文件中，读取该文件，每个行，然后将每个行添加为字符串数组的元素。This method opens a file, reads each line of the file, then adds each line as an element of a string array. 它然后关闭该文件。It then closes the file. 定义为字符后跟回车符 ('\r') 的序列，换行符 (\n) 或一个回车符后紧跟行线源。A line is defined as a sequence of characters followed by a carriage return ('\r'), a line feed ('\n'), or a carriage return immediately followed by a line feed. 生成的字符串不包含终止回车符和/或换行符。The resulting string does not contain the terminating carriage return and/or line feed. 此方法尝试自动检测根据字节顺序标记存在的文件的编码。This method attempts to automatically detect the encoding of a file based on the presence of byte order marks. 编码格式化 utf-8，并可以检测 utf-32 （big endian 和小 endian）。Encoding formats UTF-8 and UTF-32 (both big-endian and little-endian) can be detected. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将方法以显示文件的内容。The following code example demonstrates the use of the method to display the contents of a file. 在此示例中创建一个文件，如果它尚不存在，并且文本已添加到它。In this example a file is created, if it doesn't already exist, and text is added to it. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法打开一个文件，读取该文件，每个行，然后将每个行添加为字符串数组的元素。This method opens a file, reads each line of the file, and then adds each line as an element of a string array. 它然后关闭该文件。It then closes the file. 定义为字符后跟回车符 ('\r') 的序列，换行符 (\n) 或一个回车符后紧跟行线源。A line is defined as a sequence of characters followed by a carriage return ('\r'), a line feed ('\n'), or a carriage return immediately followed by a line feed. 生成的字符串不包含终止回车符和/或换行符。The resulting string does not contain the terminating carriage return and/or line feed. 此方法尝试自动检测根据字节顺序标记存在的文件的编码。This method attempts to automatically detect the encoding of a file based on the presence of byte order marks. 编码格式化 utf-8，并可以检测 utf-32 （big endian 和小 endian）。Encoding formats UTF-8 and UTF-32 (both big-endian and little-endian) can be detected. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将方法以显示文件的内容。The following code example demonstrates the use of the method to display the contents of a file. 在此示例中创建一个文件，如果它尚不存在，并且文本已添加到它。In this example a file is created, if it doesn't already exist, and text is added to it. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法打开一个文件中，读取该文件，每个行，然后添加每个行作为字符串的元素。This method opens a file, reads each line of the file, and then adds each line as an element of a string. 它然后关闭该文件。It then closes the file. 定义为字符后跟回车符 ('\r') 的序列，换行符 (\n) 或一个回车符后紧跟行线源。A line is defined as a sequence of characters followed by a carriage return ('\r'), a line feed ('\n'), or a carriage return immediately followed by a line feed. 生成的字符串不包含终止回车符和/或换行符。The resulting string does not contain the terminating carriage return and/or line feed. 此方法尝试自动检测根据字节顺序标记存在的文件的编码。This method attempts to automatically detect the encoding of a file based on the presence of byte order marks. 编码格式化 utf-8，并可以检测 utf-32 （big endian 和小 endian）。Encoding formats UTF-8 and UTF-32 (both big-endian and little-endian) can be detected. 使用方法重载时读取文件可能包含导入的文本，因为无法识别的字符可能无法正确读取。Use the method overload when reading files that might contain imported text, because unrecognized characters may not be read correctly. 文件句柄保证即将关闭此方法，即使引发异常。The file handle is guaranteed to be closed by this method, even if exceptions are raised. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将方法以显示文件的内容。The following code example demonstrates the use of the method to display the contents of a file. 在此示例中创建一个文件，如果它尚不存在，并且文本已添加到它。In this example a file is created, if it doesn't already exist, and text is added to it. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法打开一个文件中，读取该文件，每个行，然后添加每个行作为字符串的元素。This method opens a file, reads each line of the file, and then adds each line as an element of a string. 它然后关闭该文件。It then closes the file. 定义为字符后跟回车符 ('\r') 的序列，换行符 (\n) 或一个回车符后紧跟行线源。A line is defined as a sequence of characters followed by a carriage return ('\r'), a line feed ('\n'), or a carriage return immediately followed by a line feed. 生成的字符串不包含终止回车符和/或换行符。The resulting string does not contain the terminating carriage return and/or line feed. 此方法尝试自动检测根据字节顺序标记存在的文件的编码。This method attempts to automatically detect the encoding of a file based on the presence of byte order marks. 编码格式化 utf-8，并可以检测 utf-32 （big endian 和小 endian）。Encoding formats UTF-8 and UTF-32 (both big-endian and little-endian) can be detected. 文件句柄保证即将关闭此方法，即使引发异常。The file handle is guaranteed to be closed by this method, even if exceptions are raised. 若要使用的编码设置为你的操作系统配置，指定属性`encoding`参数。To use the encoding settings as configured for your operating system, specify the property for the `encoding` parameter. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将方法以显示文件的内容。The following code example demonstrates the use of the method to display the contents of a file. 在此示例中创建一个文件，如果它尚不存在，并且文本已添加到它。In this example a file is created, if it doesn't already exist, and text is added to it. remarks.format: ## Remarks 和方法的行为有所不同，如下所示： 当你使用，你可以启动之前，则返回整个集合枚举字符串的集合; 当你使用，你必须等到整个字符串的数组是返回之前才能访问该数组。The and methods differ as follows: When you use , you can start enumerating the collection of strings before the whole collection is returned; when you use , you must wait for the whole array of strings be returned before you can access the array. 因此，当你使用非常大的文件，可能更有效。Therefore, when you are working with very large files, can be more efficient. 你可以使用方法来执行以下操作：You can use the method to do the following: - 执行[LINQ to Objects](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/73cafe73-37cf-46e7-bfa7-97c7eea7ced9)文件以获取经过筛选的其行集上的查询。Perform [LINQ to Objects](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/73cafe73-37cf-46e7-bfa7-97c7eea7ced9) queries on a file to obtain a filtered set of its lines. - 写入的文件的行返回的集合方法，或将它们追加到现有文件与方法。Write the returned collection of lines to a file with the method, or append them to an existing file with the method. - 创建的集合的采用立即填充的实例其构造函数的字符串集合，如或。Create an immediately populated instance of a collection that takes an collection of strings for its constructor, such as a or a . 此方法使用编码值。This method uses for the encoding value. ## Examples 下面的示例读取的文件以查找包含指定的字符串的行的行。The following example reads the lines of a file to find lines that contain specified strings. [!code-csharp[System.IO.File.ReadLines#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.io.file.readlines/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.File.ReadLines#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.io.file.readlines/vb/program.vb#1)] 下面的示例使用中枚举了扩展名为.txt 的文件的所有目录的 LINQ 查询方法读取的文件，每一行，然后显示的行，如果它包含字符串"Microsoft"。The following example uses the method in a LINQ query that enumerates all directories for files that have a .txt extension, reads each line of the file, and displays the line if it contains the string "Microsoft". span.span: Replaces the contents of a specified file with the contents of another file, deleting the original file, and creating a backup of the replaced file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法会指定文件的内容替换为另一个文件的内容。The method replaces the contents of a specified file with the contents of another file. 它还将创建被替换文件的备份。It also creates a backup of the file that was replaced. 如果`sourceFileName`和`destinationFileName`是在不同的卷上，此方法将引发的异常。If the `sourceFileName` and `destinationFileName` are on different volumes, this method will raise an exception. 如果`destinationBackupFileName`是将源文件中的其他卷上, 删除备份文件。If the `destinationBackupFileName` is on a different volume from the source file, the backup file will be deleted. 传递`null`到`destinationBackupFileName`参数，如果你不想要创建被替换文件的备份。Pass `null` to the `destinationBackupFileName` parameter if you do not want to create a backup of the file being replaced. 如果`destinationBackupFileName`已存在的内容将被覆盖它`destinationFileName`文件。If the `destinationBackupFileName` already exists it will be overwritten with the contents of the `destinationFileName` file. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用方法将替换为另一个文件的文件并创建被替换文件的备份。The following code example uses the method to replace a file with another file and create a backup of the replaced file. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法适用于表示非继承的 ACL 列表的文件的访问控制列表 (ACL) 项。The method applies access control list (ACL) entries to a file that represents the noninherited ACL list. > [!CAUTION] > 为 ACL 指定`fileSecurity`参数替换现有文件 ACL。The ACL specified for the `fileSecurity` parameter replaces the existing ACL for the file. 若要添加的新用户的权限，请使用方法来获取现有的 ACL，对其进行修改，然后使用以将其应用回的文件。To add permissions for a new user, use the method to obtain the existing ACL, modify it, and then use to apply it back to the file. ACL 描述个人和/或组具有或没有执行到给定的文件上的特定操作的权限。An ACL describes individuals and/or groups who have, or do not have, rights to specific actions on the given file. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：添加或移除访问控制列表项](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md)。For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md). 方法仍然仅存在对象创建后已修改的对象。The method persists only objects that have been modified after object creation. 如果尚未修改对象，它不会保留到文件。If a object has not been modified, it will not be persisted to a file. 因此，不能检索对象从一个文件，并重新对同一对象应用到另一个文件。Therefore, it is not possible to retrieve a object from one file and reapply the same object to another file. 若要将 ACL 信息从一个文件复制到另一个：To copy ACL information from one file to another: 1. 使用方法来检索源文件中的对象。Use the method to retrieve the object from the source file. 2. 创建一个新目标文件的对象。Create a new object for the destination file. 3. 使用或方法的源要检索 ACL 信息对象。Use the or method of the source object to retrieve the ACL information. 4. 使用或方法的信息复制到目标的步骤 3 中检索对象。Use the or method to copy the information retrieved in step 3 to the destination object. 5. 设置目标到目标文件使用的对象方法。Set the destination object to the destination file using the method. 在 NTFS 环境中，和如果用户具有向用户授予上的父文件夹的权限。In NTFS environments, and are granted to the user if the user has rights on the parent folder. 若要拒绝和，拒绝上的父目录。To deny and , deny on the parent directory. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用和方法添加，然后删除访问控制列表 (ACL) 项从一个文件。The following code example uses the and methods to add and then remove an access control list (ACL) entry from a file. 你必须提供有效的用户或组帐户以运行此示例。You must supply a valid user or group account to run this example. [!code-cpp[IO.File.GetAccessControl-SetAccessControl#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/IO.File.GetAccessControl-SetAccessControl/cpp/sample.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[IO.File.GetAccessControl-SetAccessControl#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/IO.File.GetAccessControl-SetAccessControl/CS/sample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[IO.File.GetAccessControl-SetAccessControl#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/IO.File.GetAccessControl-SetAccessControl/VB/sample.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法使用 utf-8 编码而无需字节顺序标记 (BOM)，因此使用方法将返回一个空字节数组。This method uses UTF-8 encoding without a Byte-Order Mark (BOM), so using the method will return an empty byte array. 如果需要包含 utf-8 的标识符，如字节顺序标记，在文件的开头使用方法重载编码。If it is necessary to include a UTF-8 identifier, such as a byte order mark, at the beginning of a file, use the method overload with encoding. 此方法给定字符串和文件路径，在打开指定的文件，将字符串写入该文件，，然后关闭该文件。Given a string and a file path, this method opens the specified file, writes the string to the file, and then closes the file. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将方法以向文件写入文本。The following code example demonstrates the use of the method to write text to a file. 在此示例中创建一个文件，如果它尚不存在，并且文本已添加到它。In this example a file is created, if it doesn't already exist, and text is added to it.
